page.title: 04WATERWORKS
page.content: One of the most important buildings of the area is the Waterworks built in 1917.It was modernised in 1955 & will be completely remodernised in 1990.The Waterworks Authority is in charge of three dams(which provide water for both domestic & industrial use)plus one compensatory dam. AGDEN_built_1869_capacity_558million gallons. STRINES_built_1869_capacity_452million gallons. DALEDYKE_built_1875_capacity_465millio n gallons. DAMFLASK COMPENSATORY DAM_1896_ 1107 million gallons. A village was submerged when Damflask was built.The Waterworks provides 8,000,000 gallons of pure water daily for Sheffield.This pure water is often taken for granted;people object to paying & yet how lucky we are!
